alert.note: Alert for Concho; Mason; McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:47AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McCulloch, northeastern Menard, northwestern Mason and southeastern Concho Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 147 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Us-83 Near The Menard- Concho County Line, or 7 miles northwest of Menard, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Hext, Calf Creek, Us-190 Near The Menard- Mcculloch County Line and The Intersection Of Us- 190 And Ranch Road 1311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
